(26/42/49) Dear Sir, With reference to your letter No. 11/2783 of the 2Cth Varch, I am aesired to say that at present there are no local regulations prohibiting the fuelling of aircraft with passengers aboard. In the circumstances, the Political Resident sees no objection to your proposals provided the Royal Air roice and International Aeradio concur in them. Yours faithfully. (SGD).A.L.A.DREDGE. Aviation Service, Bahrain.mmam & Copy of letter 11/2783 of the 20th March from the Branch Manager of the BP Aviation Service, Bahrain, to His Excellency the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bahrain, AVIATION - FUELLING INSTRUCTIONS . We have been informed by our Basrah Office that the B.P Aviation Service fuelling instructions have hitherto forbidden the fuelling of aircraft to be carried out while passengers remain on board and they were advised that on numerous occasions the major airline companies have requested that fuelling with passengers aboard the aircraft should be carried 01 out. It is, therefore, the intention of the B.P Aviation Service to permit such fuelling of aircraft in the future provided that the following stipulations are strictly complied wlth;- 1) In no case will fuelling be carried out unless the regulations of the country and aerodrome concerned so permit. 2) Any fuelling of aircraft with passengers on board shall only be carried out at the specific request of the airline concerned. In all cases a senior member of the aircraft crew must remain in charge of the passengers whilst fuelling is taking place. All exit doors must be open and exit laaaers in place. 4) All normal fire precautions will be strictly adhered to as usual. matter. V»e shall be glad to hc.ve your comments on the (SGD). physicalDescription.extent: The three items of correspondence are followed by a page of file notes (f 5).

Foliation: the foliation sequence commences at the front cover, and terminates at the inside back cover; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file relates to fuelling instructions at the aerodrome in Bahrain. A copy of a letter from the Branch Manager of the BP [British Petroleum] Aviation Service, to the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf, dated 20 March 1949 (f 4), states that the company will permit fuelling of aircraft while passengers are on board, with certain stipulations. A reply to the letter, sent by the First Secretary at the Political Residency, dated 23 March 1946 (f 3), states that there are at present no local regulations prohibiting the fuelling of aircraft with passengers on board.
